fields.summary: Enable cluster performance tests for stable
Logical sorting of lucene index items for people in Share feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23698].
  {panel}

The Confluence API has a VersionHistorySummary object:
http://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/core/VersionHistorySummary.html

What we wanted to do is pull out all the versions of a page, and decide to do certain actions based on whether each version was a minor or major revision. It seems that this state is not exposed out to the API. 

Can you add this state in future API versions?
fields.summary: The API should return whether a page revision in version history was major or minor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23692].
  {panel}

In the status macro, the user can set macro colour as well as the title (i.e. the text that appears on the lozenge)

The usability of this would greatly increase if users were able to allocate colour - title pairs.

For example
|| Colour || Title||
| Red | Failure |
| Green | Pass |
| Yellow | In Progress |
| Grey | On hold |
| Grey | Not started |

When one half of these pairs are specified, the user will have to only specify colour or title and the corresponding status or colour (respectively) will be invoked.

For example, if the current status is
Red / Failure

The user would only have to switch to Green to get a status of
Green / Pass

Currently, a user has to change both the colour AND the status manually resulting in a more cumbersome user experience.
fields.summary: Allow status macro title field to correspond to a particular colour and vice versa
Attachment Undelete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23689].
  {panel}

The description pasted from the [documentation here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication#ConnectingtoanInternalDirectorywithLDAPAuthentication-MembershipSchemaSettings]:

||Setting|Description||
|Group Members Attribute|The attribute field to use when loading the group's members. Example:
member|
|User Membership Attribute|The attribute field to use when loading the user's groups. Example:
memberOf|
|Use the User Membership Attribute, when finding the user's group membership|Select the check box if your directory server supports the group membership attribute on the user. (By default, this is the 'memberOf' attribute.)
If this check box is selected, your application will use the group membership attribute on the user when retrieving the members of a given group. This will result in a more efficient retrieval.
If this check box is not selected, your application will use the members attribute on the group ('member' by default) for the search.|

The last option does not seem to apply the configuration. It just skips it and doesn't bring the Groups a user belong.
fields.summary: "Use the User Membership Attribute, when finding the user's group membership" does not work when enabled in User Directory.
Allow administrator to export the user directory to a spreadsheet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23683].
  {panel}

If you create a note macro as per the documentation [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Note+Macro] and not include an optional title the alignment of the exclamation mark to the text isn't fantastic. Check out the screenshot below for an example:

!note.png!

If you make that first line the title it looks all good:

!note_good.png!
fields.summary: note macro alignment is out unless an optional title is entered
Footer should always be visible when in Preview mode
Link to headings via the Link Browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23678].
  {panel}

We are using Confluence to capture and publish project documentation from different field engineers. Our dashboard has a number of spaces, one of which is "Field Engineering". We you enter that space you are presented with a tree of pages where we list projects. 

The top-level page for ProjectA is given as:

    http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/ProjectA

The top-level page for ProjectB is given as:

    http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/ProjectB

Creating a "Background" page for ProjectA would create the URL:

    http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/Background

Creating a situation where ProjectB would would have to call its "Background" page something else simply to avoid a collision on the URLs.

If the page name is to be used for the URL, it should be used relative to its location in the tree. Something like:

http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/ProjectA/Background
http://abc.xyx.com:8080/display/FIELD/ProjectB/Background
fields.summary: Disassociate page name and URL to allow two pages with the same name to exist with different URLs.

The requirement to run PluginFramework Dependent upgrade tasks is not persistent. So if you kill an upgrading instance before it run the tasks and then restart it again, it will no longer attempt to run these tasks on start up.
Clustering is seeing a number of failed test in Confluence 4.0 right
Migration of wiki to XHTML is not happening on the cluster set up used for performance test builds

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23668].
  {panel}

I often need to search my Confluence site, to see where a specific macro is used, or to find a specific use of a given macro. I used to be able to do that by enclosing my search in double quotes and entering the relevant bit of wiki markup.

For example:
* To search for all inclusion macros that include the page called "_QRG_Colour", I just entered the following text into the search box:
"include:_QRG_Colour"
* To search for all inclusion macros, I entered "{include".
* To search for all children macros, I entered "{children"

This no longer works, or at least I can't find a way of making it work. Please restore the functionality or document a workaround. It is essential for maintaining technical documentation.

An alternative would be for Confluence to provide a cross-reference, maybe at space level, of where each macro is used.
fields.summary: Cannot do site-wide search for macros used on pages
Ability to find a specific macro on a Confluence page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23662].
  {panel}

Hello,

We really love confluence. And one of the best things in it is "Wiki markup" tab.
It's gone since last update. We want it back.

I cannot stress you how hard it is for us to edit our documents without this tool. You should try to do it by yourself or read comments on the page which describes new cool editor.

I know you did a great job and the new editor is very smart, but this is the situation when coders are coding for the code.
fields.summary: Please bring "Wiki" tab back in editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23661].
  {panel}

[Confluence Data Model page in CAC|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Data+Model] needs to be updated:

General Database Diagram - The diagram is outdated. There are new tables introduced since Confluence 3.5 and one more new table introduced in 4.0 as listed below:
|| Table Name || Description || Version Notes ||
| CWD_APP_DIR_GROUP_MAPPING \\ | Groups assigned to each application. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APP_DIR_MAPPING \\ | Directories assigned to each application. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APP_DIR_OPERATION \\ | Application-level permissions for adding, modifying and removing users, groups and roles from a directory. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APPLICATION \\ | All applications listed in Crowd. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APPLICATION_ADDRESS \\ | Remote addresses currently assigned to each application. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_APPLICATION_ATTRIBUTE \\ | Attributes for an application. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_DIRECTORY \\ | All directories listed in Crowd. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_DIRECTORY_ATTRIBUTE \\ | Attributes for a directory. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_DIRECTORY_OPERATION \\ | Permissions for adding, modifying and removing users, groups and roles from a directory. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_GROUP \\ | Groups from internal directories. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_GROUP_ATTRIBUTE \\ | Attributes for a group. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_MEMBERSHIP \\ | Group members from internal directories. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_USER \\ | Users from internal directories. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_USER_ATTRIBUTE \\ | Attributes for a user. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| CWD_USER_CREDENTIAL_RECORD \\ | Hashed passwords for each user. \\ | Introduced in Confluence 3.5 \\ |
| LOGININFO | Information of user login. | Introduced in Confluence 4.0 \\ |
fields.summary: To Update Confluence Data Model Page In CAC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23657].
  {panel}

Hi

I have avery messy and full Confluence - problem is pages were poorly maintained and are mostly abandoned and unused. A feature to export only recently added/edited pages. Some methofd to determine what pages are junk and that can be archived and removed from searches and exports.

Going through thousands of pages manually and delteing the old/unused pages is an extrmely tedious task.

I Logged this feature request because I was informed (after logging a support request) nothing of the sort is available for Confluence at the moment.


Kind Regards
Hendrik
fields.summary: Export and Archiving functions to cleanup a Messy Confluence

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23650]. {panel} This bug is usually encountered when you copy and paste from another web page which contain invisible anchor links. Anchor links normally appear on big pages which begin with a table of contents of links to allow a user to quickly navigate to the relevant section of the page. The anchor link will typically be declared above or near the headings on this page. If you copy and paste a section that includes a heading, it is likely you have also copied an anchor. To know for sure, you can view the HTML source of the page if you are comfortable doing this. To reproduce this bug: # Open the [attached test.htm|^test.htm] file. It has an invisible anchor markup: . Notice the anchor has a start and end element with an empty body. Also notice it is not an empty element: i.e.
fields.summary: Confluence serves anchors to the browser as an empty element <a name="..." /> which the browsers don't handle very well leading to all subsequent text being rendered as a link
Allow some pages of public space to be only accessible via a hidden URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23645].
  {panel}

Confluence CLI is being used, but it doesn't do much other than call the *addAttachment* Remote API service. The [documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Confluence+XML-RPC+and+SOAP+APIs] says:
bq. Note that this uses a lot of memory - about 4 times the size of the attachment.

Can attach files around 3 MBs, but problems when larger files. 13 MBs fails (see https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/CSOAP-114). I attempted 23 MBs with a 4GB java heap size. Same file can be attached via UI fine.

{noformat}
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space; nested exception is: 
	java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at org.apache.axis.message.SOAPFaultBuilder.createFault(SOAPFaultBuilder.java:222)
	at org.apache.axis.message.SOAPFaultBuilder.endElement(SOAPFaultBuilder.java:129)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.DeserializationContext.endElement(DeserializationContext.java:1087)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(AbstractSAXParser.java:601)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanEndElement(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:1782)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDriver.next(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:2938)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentScannerImpl.next(XMLDocumentScannerImpl.java:648)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLNSDocumentScannerImpl.next(XMLNSDocumentScannerImpl.java:140)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:511)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(XML11Configuration.java:808)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(XML11Configuration.java:737)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XMLParser.parse(XMLParser.java:119)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:1205)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(SAXParserImpl.java:522)
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:395)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.DeserializationContext.parse(DeserializationContext.java:227)
	at org.apache.axis.SOAPPart.getAsSOAPEnvelope(SOAPPart.java:696)
	at org.apache.axis.Message.getSOAPEnvelope(Message.java:435)
	at org.apache.axis.handlers.soap.MustUnderstandChecker.invoke(MustUnderstandChecker.java:62)
	at org.apache.axis.client.AxisClient.invoke(AxisClient.java:206)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invokeEngine(Call.java:2784)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:2767)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:2443)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:2366)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:1812)
	at org.swift.common.soap.confluence.ConfluenceserviceV2SoapBindingStub.addAttachment(ConfluenceserviceV2SoapBindingStub.java:4857)
	at org.swift.confluence.cli.ConfluenceClient.addAttachment(ConfluenceClient.java:1707)
	at org.swift.confluence.cli.ConfluenceClient.addAttachment(ConfluenceClient.java:1646)
	at org.swift.confluence.cli.ConfluenceClient.handleRequest(ConfluenceClient.java:471)
	at org.swift.common.cli.AbstractRemoteClient.process(AbstractRemoteClient.java:119)
	at org.swift.common.cli.CliClient.doWork(CliClient.java:225)
	at org.swift.confluence.cli.ConfluenceClient.main(ConfluenceClient.java:115)
{noformat}

h4. Workaround
- Attach the file through Confluence interface
- Use "doattachfile.action" controller using a tool like [curl|http://curl.haxx.se/], so your command line would look like:

{noformat}
curl -F file_0=@<path to file> -F pageId=<confluence page id> -u <username>:<password> "http://Confluence-URL/pages/doattachfile.action"
{noformat}
or,
- Use WebDAV and intermediary mean to upload/attach files. For more details on this, please review the following docs:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Uploading+Data+via+WebDAV
fields.summary: OutOfMemoryError with Remote API addAttachment service

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23619].

{quote}if you attach a pdf (probably all other attachement types are affected as well) to a page where the filename contains a umlaut like "äüö.pdf" you cant:
 * link to that attachment (link is greyed out and does not work)
 * view it (returns a "Page Not Found" error)

 * view/edit properties (returns a {code}java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.MoveAttachmentAction.bootstrap(MoveAttachmentAction.java:112){code} should i include the full stack trace?
{quote}

***Workaround***
Cloud users will need to create a [support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com] for us to apply the workaround. Please provide a suitable downtime for a maintenance update when creating the support ticket.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23605].
  {panel}

Blog post macro in excerpt mode ignores the text formatting in blog. It didn't occur in 3.5.9, but it occurs in 4.0. Here's the example of the bug, both 3.5.9 and 4.0.

||h4. Blog Post in 3.5.9||h4. Blog Post in 4.0||
|!blog359.png|width=350!|!blog40.png|width=350!|
\\

||h4. Blog Post Macro excerpt in 3.5.9||h4. Blog Post Macro excerpt in 4.0||
|!blogmacro359.png|width=350!|!blogmacro40.png|width=350!|
fields.summary: Show formatting for Blog posts macro in excerpt mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23602].
  {panel}

Looking at the internals of our PropertySet implementation I've discovered that after retrieving an instance of a PropertySet, any subsequent calls to setXXXX() on the PropertySet can trigger duplicate OS_PROPERTYENTRY rows to be inserted with the same identifier (not, its not the creation or fetching of the PropertySet instance, but the invocation of setXX() that triggers the insertion). 

There also appears to be issues with concurrently updating an existing PropertySet (but I can't explain why yet). 

These two issues has caused the introduction of thread synchronisation (an example can be found in DefaultLoginManager.onSuccessfulLoginAttempt()). 

We should consider introducing this synchronisation on our PropertySet implementation or some other solution that will address the above two issues (obviously thread synchronisation will not fix the issue in a cluster).
fields.summary: Duplicate PropertySets with the same identifier can be created
can't delete tables within a table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23597].
{panel}
*Actions:*
 # Open Word document.
 # Copy/paste text from Word doc into Confluence page.
 # Copy/paste image from Word doc into Confluence page.

*Expected:*
Text and images copied into the page, images stored as attachments.

*Actual:*
Text copied into the page.

_IE 8_ - No option to paste images.
 _Firefox 7_ - Image doesn't copy or paste on Mac, works perfectly on Win7.
 _Safari 5.1_ - Image copies and appears in the edit window, then appears as a broken link when saved.
 _Chrome_ - Text is copied, images not.

*Update:*
The issue can be reproduced on all recent version of browser.
fields.summary: Copying images from Word documents inconsistent across browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23590].
  {panel}

Please change the documentation theme to support user-specified heading colors.

When I set the color scheme for the standard theme, the Heading Text setting changes the color of headings in the page, including the page title.

When I use the same color scheme for the documentation theme, the headings are black text, regardless of my changes to the color scheme. Why? If I want the nav bar to stay black, I can edit that. Why limit my heading colors.

See attached color scheme for the space at https://digbycms.onconfluence.com/display/LMMALL/LMM+Updates. It all works, but to get the blue headings in the pages, I had to add a color tag to each one. Note that the page titles are black, because you can't put a color tag in that field.
fields.summary: Documentation theme should support the heading text colors set in the color scheme.
List page anchors while adding a new anchor link on the same page
Improve how spaces appear in the space directory tabs Space Directory - order by category, support spaces in labels
Please provide us with migration path from Confluence 2.9.2 to newer version 4.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23583].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The table's border become invisible after export to a word file, this issue however does not affect Open Office, it only affects user with Microsoft Office. -Thus, Open office can be used as a workaround.- (Unfortunately, the generated files generally don't open correctly in editors other than MS Office, check this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26113).

There's a similar bug for PDF exports:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34390

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Here is the reproduction procedure: 
# Add a table with wide columns to a new page then save it. (original.png)
# Export the page to the a word file. 
# On the word file


h3. Expected Results
The table fits the file correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The border of the table become invisible. (export+to+word.doc)

h3.Workaround
*Partial workaround*
# Use workaround [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34390] to export a PDF file that shows that table correctly
# Export as PDF
# Use some PDF to Word converter, like [this one|https://acrobat.adobe.com/us/en/how-to/pdf-to-word-doc-converter.html]
fields.summary: The table's border become invisible in the output of the "Export to word"
Conflicting shortcut for paste-special/paste table row

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23581].
  {panel}

With the new RTE in Confluence 4.0 macros got a placeholder to visualize them better, but this also meant we lost the ability to fast and easily edit macro properties, instead we always have to select the placeholder, click edit and then modify, this causes for a huge step back in productivity.

A Suggestion would be to allow to edit this properties as a direct inline text field.
A First implementation would be one single text-field using the old syntax to separate different properties.
This could cause a number of errors like misspelled parameters etc. But would be far better than what it is now.

Future implementations could improve it even further i guess or the initial could as well, because this might not be the ideal solution I have suggested for a number of reasons, but the dialog is not even a solution, that is an obstacle...

(Attachment is a really quick and dirty mockup)
fields.summary: Edit Macro properties in placeholder header
Allow section macro's border to be displayed even though without column macro within

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23569].
  {panel}

Hi guys, 
In v3.x of Confluence we could preview the body of a macro before inserting it into a page. It would be great if we could get this in Confluence 4.0 too.

Picture in docs here needs to be updated, section: "Using the 'Hello World' Macro on a Page": 
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Hello+World+Example+of+User+Macro
fields.summary: Macro and User Macro - Preview Body Parameter in Confluence 4.0
Warning message when removing User Macros
Autoformat for JIRA URL
Why I can't search for an specific word e.g. "$TOOLS_JAVA"?
Provide the ability to search for page names referenced in 'Include' and 'Excerpt Include' macros on a Confluence page in edit mode.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23560].
  {panel}

In edit mode, the length of macros are truncated, which means that if you have pages with long names included on the page you're editing, you cannot see the full names of these included pages. This is very problematic if the titles of these long-named inclusion pages only differ towards the end of their titles.

Finding out the full name of an included page now requires manual intervention. In Confluence 3.5, you could simply glance at it in Wiki Markup.

To work around this visual limitation, I've had to rename all the inclusion pages so I can see them at a glance (to work out whether or not they need revising).

Incidentally, expecting a Confluence 4.0 user to simply view the storage format (i.e. XHTML) to see these page names _is not an acceptable workaround_ - especially if you're not going to provide them with a way to edit this XHTML content (in an indented readable format).

*Suggested Solution:*

Extend the length of the macro (displayed in edit mode) to the full width of the edit box.
fields.summary: Show the full name of pages in 'Include' and 'Excerpt Include' macros on a Confluence page in edit mode.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23557].
  {panel}

The startup script uses pushd and popd, which may not port to all systems.  A fix is included below:

before:

pushd $SOMEDIR
do_something
popd

after:

PUSHED_DIR=`pwd`
cd $SOMEDIR
do_something
cd $PUSHED_DIR
fields.summary: Startup script requires BASH -- must be sh compatible for Ubuntu
Enable user to choose between 'custom space logo' thumbnail icon and 'default space' icon
Russian links in {toc} follow to wrong places

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23552].
  {panel}

Confluence 4.0 onwards installer bundles only the JRE. This leads to the confusion on end users whether JDK is really required to run Confluence. If it turned out that JDK is not required any more, would be good to make this clear in the docs. Here are couple of pages I found that might needs correction:
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Java+for+Confluence
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/System+Requirements
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+Connect+to+SSL+Services+due+to+PKIX+Path+Building+Failed+sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException

Couple of similar CONF issues raised previously:
CONF-6807
CONF-21705
CONF-12311
fields.summary: Clarification whether Confluence requires JRE vs. JDK since the installer bundles the JRE only
Support Java 7
Allow users to specify alt and title for images in the WYSIWYG editor
Installer/Upgrader should import SSL KeyStore or allow reuse a custom, existing JVM
Attach larger pictures to the profil

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23540].
  {panel}

* Grant anonymous access to a space
* As an anonymous user, add a page to the space
* Click any page in the move page dialog


{noformat}Message: 'm' is null or not an object
Line: 3467
Char: 1073
Code: 0
URI: http://chang:8080/confluence/s/en_GB/3018/117/2/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js{noformat}



URL = http://chang:8080/confluence/pages/createpage-entervariables.action?spaceKey=anon&templateId=0&confirm=Next
Browser = Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E; .NET CLR 2.0.50727)
fields.summary: Move page on save dialog gives an error to anonymous users on IE
Cursor can get stuck in tables
Tabbing to a new cell is broken in IE9
Images with special characters in the filename don't get rendered on error
Aligning an image loses the focus
Safari: Cmd-B and Cmd-I still work in preformatted text even though the toolbar shows these disabled.
Admin colour scheme popup is small in IE9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23528].
  {panel}

Page merging behaviour is different if multiple users are editing a row that existed before they started editing as opposed to a new row they created during their editing session.

Compare the following examples:
Say a page has the following table header only
||Name||Guess||
Two users start editing the page at the same time, they both add a row underneath the header. Both users perceive that they are both editing the first non-header row.
When they save however, both of their rows get integrated without conflict warning
||Name||Guess||
|Roadrunner|Free birdseed?|
|Wylie Coyote|ACME Trap|

While this behaviour is not inherently problematic, it is inconsistent with behaviour in a situation that a user may *perceive* as identical

Take a second example
Say the page above had a table header with a blank first row to encourage collaborators to enter data
||Name||Guess||
| | |
Two users start editing the page at the same time and they both fill in the blank row provided. Roadrunner saves first. Wylie Coyote saves second and is presented with the conflict warning page.
The behaviours in both scenarios in isolation are acceptable, the inconsistency across both scenarios might confuse users. They might wonder why they get a conflict in the second scenario and not in the first and reason that it is a bug.
fields.summary: Page merging behaviour for tables may seem erratic to a user
User can change the paragraph style of plain text macro
An image or macro can be inserted into autocomplete
Preformatted text overflows in table when editiing
Cell selection doesn't work when using the keyboard
Toggling preformatted text in a macro applies it to the entire text
Page jumps around like a drunk grasshopper while writing a comment in a non-maximised window
Page name warning == content scrolls off bottom of page, unreachable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23507].
  {panel}

At the top level of a document, if I choose preformatted text I get these behaviours -
# pressing return ends the preformatted block
# if I had previous lines of paragraph text and then I choose 'preformatted'. The preformat style only applies to the new text I am going to type.

If, within an info macro I do the same as above then I get these behaviours instead -
# pressing return creates a new preformatted block
# choosing preformatted applies the style to the entire content of the placeholder.
fields.summary: Preformatted blocks behave different in a rich text macro compared to in the top of the document
When a naming error occurs you can no longer scroll to the bottom of the document
Extra slash is added to the end of a web link in IE
Drag & Drop area flickers on Safari and sometimes prevents upload

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23503].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
* Start editing a page.
* Create an info macro (for example).
* Set the style to preformatted.
* Start typing and then maybe press enter a couple of times.

*What happens*
* The macro placeholder top disappears
* Pressing 'enter' has no effect (seemingly) but viewing source shows {{br}} tags.
fields.summary: Preformatted text breaks macro in IE8 only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23501].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
* Start editing a page.
* Create an info macro (for example).
* Type some text in normal paragraph style.
* Switch to preformatted style and continue typing.

*What happens*
The cursor jumps out of the macro body. See attached video for an example.
fields.summary: Switching to preformatted text in macro body causes cursor to jump out of macro in IE8 only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23500].
  {panel}

Recreate an ordered list that looks like this in confluence:

# line 1
# line 2
## line 3
## line 4
### line 5
###
###
## line 6
# line 7

if you place your cursor inside the empty lines between line 5 and 6 and hit ENTER, then nothing happens. See Jim's video attached.
fields.summary: ENTER doesn't work when inside a blank, double-indented line within an ordered list
When dragging and dropping an image into the comments box, the input doesn't expand so I can see the whole image or the text underneath it.
Cursor disappears after entering table via autoformatting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23490].
  {panel}

Given a partly filled table, adding additional content will still add new cells instead of putting the change within the old one.  Even after the current fix to CONFDEV-3302

For example: 
| Heading | More Heading |
| First Row A | First Row B |
| | |

And then fill out the last row: 
| Heading | More Heading |
| First Row A | First Row B |
| Second Row A | Second Row B |
Will create a diff like this:

| Heading | More Heading |
| First Row A | First Row B |
|  |  | Second Row A | Second Row B |

I have tried to fix this in daisydiff with no success (well, not without breaking more things).
fields.summary: Adding content to blank table cells adds new cells
We seem to share SQL session between threads
Current merge algorithm does not seem to present a conflict when one is expected in some cases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23482].
  {panel}

On chrome:
1. Create a new page
2. Insert a horizontal rule as the first thing on the page
3. Press enter
Another HR is created every time you press enter. You can delete all of them except the first one which cannot be deleted.

On firefox:
1. Create a new page
2. Insert a horizontal rule as the first thing on the page
3. Press delete to try to delete the HR. You can't
4. Now press enter. Every time you press enter a new HR is created.

Other browsers have similar issues.
fields.summary: When you create a horizontal rule as the first thing on a page, more horizontal rules will be added after pressing enter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23476].
  {panel}

To reproduce 

1. write  "this is some content" hit cmd 
2. select the text 
3. put cursor at the end of the line
4. paste
5. paste
6. paste
7. paste

notice the ever growing and un-deletable margin.
fields.summary: Copy and paste of a single line of text results in large margins
Chrome: Outdent doesn't work (Shift+tab)
Patch/Diff macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23463].
  {panel}

Inserting pictures into a newly created page, then changing the page location to another space will create a bug were the images are lost and display an 'unknown attachment' label in place of the images.

to replicate:
1) create new page in a space
2) insert some images
3) wait to page is auto-saved
4) change the location to another space
5) select 'save'
6) open up the space and navigate to the newly created page.
fields.summary: Images Attached to Editor are erased when changing page location during draft session

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23461].
  {panel}

Some examples:

* backspacing past the beginning of a line in the code macro deletes the entire previous line
* backspacing in an inline formatted block (e.g. bold/hyperlink) will sometimes delete the entire element

There were a few more things I've seen too. Happy to play around and give you a demo if you can't reproduce.
fields.summary: Backspace deletes incorrect content in editor in Firefox (Extranet)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-23460].
  {panel}

When a user I'm following deletes a space I get an email for every single attachment they removed.
This is causing extra work for a process that's already too slow.  And it's causing me to get a lot of email I don't want.

This is only a problem for network-based notifications.  I assume Space/Content watches are deleted before anything else happens.

h3. Suggested Workaround (I haven't tried)
Hide the space before removing it.  (Actually, the user may have done that and I may still be getting notifications because I'm super-user, in which case the additional work-around is to get all super-users to stop following the user who's doing the deletion or turn off their network subscription setting).
fields.summary: Notifications should not be sent for every item when a space is deleted
When indent an item within a numbered list, it starts a letter sequence instead of number.
